meanings.definition: An investment plan in which members contribute to a common fund and receive an annuity that increases as members die.
meanings.sent1: The tontine allowed members to pool their money for a shared income.
meanings.sent2: The tontine paid out more to the remaining members as others passed away.
meanings.sent3: The tontine turned into a race to see who would outlive the rest and claim the most money.
meanings.sent4: The tontine was like a financial game of survival of the fittest.
meanings.sent5: The tontine made the concept of shared wealth through longevity quite intriguing.

meanings.definition: A group annuity in which the survivors divide the benefits of deceased members.
meanings.sent1: In the tontine, the remaining members shared the benefits left by those who passed away.
meanings.sent2: The tontine ensured that the survivors received their fair share of the benefits.
meanings.sent3: The tontine turned into a friendly competition among the remaining members.
meanings.sent4: The tontine symbolized the unity and support within the group.
meanings.sent5: The tontine vividly illustrated the concept of collective financial security.
